summary: This document is a financial record from Deutsche Bank outlining the terms under which they will accept trading instructions via electronic media from clients, specifically mentioning Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a disclaimer about the risks associated with such instructions and requires the client's acknowledgment and agreement to the terms.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned as a client who is agreeing to the terms set forth by Deutsche Bank regarding the acceptance of trading instructions via electronic media.

persons.name: Zbynek Kozelsky
persons.context: Zbynek Kozelsky is identified as the Client Advisor who is involved in the communication with Jeffrey Epstein regarding the trading instructions.

persons.name: Paul Barrett
persons.context: Paul Barrett is mentioned as a Client Advisor who is involved in the approval process of the document.

connections.description: Jeffrey Epstein is a client of Zbynek Kozelsky, who is providing financial advisory services.
Jeffrey Epstein is a client whose transactions are being managed by Paul Barrett as part of the advisory team.

keyFacts: The document outlines the terms under which Deutsche Bank will accept trading instructions via electronic media.
Jeffrey Epstein is specifically mentioned as a client agreeing to these terms.
The document includes a disclaimer about the risks associated with electronic instructions.
Zbynek Kozelsky and Paul Barrett are identified as Client Advisors involved in the process.
